title: Binance faces scrutiny as presidential adviser calls for Nigeria ban
description:
Bayo Onanuga, adviser to Nigeria’s president, accused Nigerians of being unpatriotic when trading on the Binance platform.

Updated on Feb. 22 at 9:30 am UTC: Screenshot of Binance responding to customers added.

An adviser to Nigeria’s president has called for a ban on Binance, KuCoin and other trading platforms in the country.

Bayo Onanuga — President Bola Tinubu’s adviser on information and strategy —  took to the X social media platform to allege that the platforms manipulated the country’s fiat currency, the Nigerian naira, contributing to the ongoing decline of the currency in the forex market. This is coming amid speculations that the government is already considering a ban.

Read more

title: Minutes of Federal Reserve’s Last FOMC Meeting Unveiled: What TRaders and Investors Need to Know
description: On February 21, the Federal Reserve published the minutes from the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting held January 30-31, 2024. Typically, these minutes are made public about three weeks following the Committee’s policy verdict. title: Privacy Coins Under Attack – Not Down for the Count Yet

title: Cardano founder halts showcases amid misinterpretations
description: Charles Hoskinson, the founder of Cardano, recently addressed the community regarding the showcasing of projects within the Cardano ecosystem.  In a live broadcast from Colorado, he emphasized the need to clarify the purpose behind these engagements and announced a temporary suspension of such showcases. title: Sam Bankman-Fried allowed to replace lawyers despite possible conflict
description: The founder of the cryptocurrency exchange FTX, Sam Bankman-Fried, said his former lawyers will no longer represent him before his sentencing. According to Reuters, lawyer Mark Mukasey will now join the legal team. He will represent his interests over the…
